Yes, there were some negative effects of the Turin Olympic Games in 2006, such as traffic and overcrowding. As with any major international event, the influx of visitors led to an increase in traffic congestion and some overcrowding in certain areas of the city. The construction of new sports facilities and infrastructure also caused some disruption and inconvenience for local residents.

However, the organizers of the Turin Olympic Games worked hard to minimize these negative effects, and many measures were put in place to reduce traffic and ensure the safety and comfort of visitors and residents alike. These included the introduction of car-free zones, expanded public transport services, and increased security throughout the city.

In the long term, the benefits of the Turin Olympic Games far outweighed any negative effects. The event brought significant economic and cultural benefits to the city, helping to boost tourism, promote winter sports, and raise the profile of Turin on the world stage. Overall, the Turin Olympic Games were a major success for the city and continue to be celebrated and remembered today.
